org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.base.plugins
Class BasicSecurityPlugin

java.lang.Object
  org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.base.DmpServletPlugin
      org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.base.plugins.BasicSecurityPlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
SecurityManagerIF
public class BasicSecurityPlugin
extends DmpServletPlugin
implements SecurityManagerIF

The BasicSecurityPlugin provides basic security mechanisms for an example application. It defines two users: user1 and user2 whose passwords are the same as the user name.

Derived classes should perform any initialization logic required. If a plugin has indicated that it depends on another plugin, it is safe to assume that the other plugin has been initialized.

login

public LoginResponse login(LoginRequest request)
Description copied from interface: SecurityManagerIF
This method should be overloaded to perform whatever authentication is required to determine that a user is allowed to connect.

public LogoutResponse logout(LogoutRequest request)
Description copied from interface: SecurityManagerIF
Terminates the associated session with the server. Any subsequent transactions that use the related session identifier will be rejected.

validateSession

public Response validateSession(Request request)
                         throws DmcValueException
All requests sent to the servlet via the Dark Matter Protocol must be associated with a valid session; all DMP Requests should have the session identifier set.

Specified by:
validateSession in interface SecurityManagerIF
Parameters:
request - the request whose session will be validated.
Returns:
null if the session is okay and an error response otherwise.
Throws:
DmcValueException
